clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life Measurement in Treatment Naïve Patients With HCV Genotype 1 Suffering From Fatigue and Receiving Ombitasvir, Paritaprevir, and Ritonavir and Dasabuvir (Viekirax®/Exviera®)
clinical_study.official_title: Quality of Life Measurement Using Wrist Actigraphy in HCV Genotype 1 Infected, Treatment naïve Patients Suffering From Fatigue and Receiving Ombitasvir, Paritaprevir, and Ritonavir Tablets and Dasabuvir Tablets (Viekirax®/Exviera®; 3D Regimen): The HEMATITE Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational, prospective, open-label, single-arm, multicenter, real-life study designed to observe the impact of paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir with dasabuvir regimen (Viekirax®/Exviera®, 3D regimen) on total daytime physical activity and fatigue in participants with Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) genotype 1 (GT1).

primary_outcome.measure: Change of mean daytime physical activity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 weeks (collect baseline data up to 4 weeks + 12-week treatment + 12-week follow-up)

secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue assessed by means of Fatigue Severity Scale (FSS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Mean Daytime Physical Activity and FSS
secondary_outcome.description: Where fatigue is assessed by means of FSS and physical activity is measured with an electronic activity tracker

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks (SVR12) Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) not detectable 12 weeks after the last actual dose of paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir with dasabuvir regimen (Viekirax®/Exviera®, 3D regimen)
Sleep efficiency assessed by means of activity tracker

arm_group.description: Participants receiving paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir with dasabuvir (Viekirax®/Exviera®, 3D regimen)

study_pop.textblock: Participants with CHC, genotype 1, receiving paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir with dasabuvir regimen (3D regimen)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment-naïve participants
- Mono-infected participants with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 1 (GT1)
- Non-cirrhotic participants
- Participants with debilitating fatigue (Fatigue Severity Scale [FSS] greater than or equal to 4)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with sources of fatigue other than HCV (especially, severe depression, cancer and hormonal disorders causing clinically significant fatigue)
- Participants with conditions that do not allow to adhere to protocol and use of the device at investigator's discretion
- Participants who are wheelchair dependent
